Now flip it around You originated that loan when rates were 1 5 but rates went to 3 If you sell you get a massive loss on sale Most of HASI's loan book is 2019 21 low rate vintage Look at Q1 AOCI Already marking down Can't sell losers Rates surged AGAIN in Q2

50 of HASI earnings are gains on sale of very long duration loans If you originated a long term low yield loan when risk free rate was 3 and rates go to 1 5 you've got a huge winner Sell it and you get a gain on sale That explains HASI's lovely 2020 amp 2021

We're short HASI And for completely different reasons than those raised by Muddy Waters This short is far more timely than most people realize Earnings can't withstand the new rate environment Even if the accounting were squeaky clean It's about gains on sale 1 4

15 15 If there is a type of misrepresentation we hate even more than accounting fraud it is greenwashing to garner an ESG stock premium The first opportunity for the PIPE investors to take advantage of this greenwashing and sell their pre IPO shares happens to be days away

14 15 Valuation TSLA makes money on each unit sold while VIEW gives its product away far below cost TSLA s volume growth last year was 25 VIEW s was 7 TSLA helps the planet VIEW hurts it So TSLA trades at 20x last year s revenues but VIEW trades at 60x

13 15 Unlike in traditional IPOs which have a research quiet period for the banks who bring the company public Cantor a major stockholder who s filed to sell its whole stake issued a Buy rating on VIEW just two weeks after the SPAC merger closed

12 15 VIEW can t get its story straight on how much of its glass has been installed The square footage number it reports has dropped over time We suspect the pre IPO numbers used VIEW s much touted design wins if so the conversion rate to actual revenues is terrible

11 15 In addition to false green credentials VIEW has claimed academic legitimacy using university studies which it wrote staffed ran edited and of course paid for Just look at the university websites

10 15 One former executive described how the VIEW CEO had his employees run the plant full out for an ENTIRE YEAR despite demand justifying only 1 10 of that production because he just wanted to see what it could do Tons of glass were given away or discarded

9 15 according to two former executives VIEW is the largest electricity consumer in the entire state of Mississippi VIEW uses massive amounts of electricity to make glass that saves almost none then brags about its energy saving mission

8 15 VIEW has suckered ESG buyers by saying it has a mission to solve climate change with its smart glass which it claims can reduce HVAC consumption by 20 Not only is this assertion ridiculous the number is more like 2 according to two different experts but

7 15 Multiple former employees and glass experts told us VIEW s smart glass production problem is native to the technology so it cannot be fixed One literally laughed out loud at the Street revenue projections for VIEW while another said I ve seen them They re insane

6 15 I will never forget standing at their Quality Control section and I was aghast They were rejecting SO much finished product This dovetails with what several former VIEW employees explained about the enormous waste and cost of this manufacturing process

5 15 VIEW s glassmaking technology while elegant in theory wasn t built for business It must produce and scrap enormous quantities of finished goods to obtain sufficient usable product One 30 year glass industry veteran identified in our report said

4 15 VIEW s enormous need for more capital is why you see such desperate revenue growth projections Absurd hockey stick forecasts were necessary to enable the SPAC infusion and remain to keep the stock afloat for future equity issuance

3 15 VIEW is no startup it has been a perennial failure to launch for 15 years flirting with insolvency multiple times It was rescued from the brink of bankruptcy in 2021 by the Cantor Fitzgerald SPAC Current cash on hand likely won t last more than a year

2 15 The most imminent downside catalyst is next week when the lockup expires for 42 million SPAC PIPE shares on June 7 P 58 of Apr 7 S 1 Shares worth almost 50 of current VIEW float will become available for sale

1 2 Hi again everyone we were honored to help investors understand accounting games in the public markets through our DOX report We expect our thesis to be proven ultimately by events rather than by jawboning so we will not be commenting on DOX for the foreseeable future
We are revealing the results of a months long examination of what we believe are damning financial anomalies at Amdocs DOX Full report at
We believe that all of these findings raise serious questions as to Amdocs financial position and management s honesty about it Opinions our own but investors beware See website for full report

As all of this was happening Amdocs experienced massive auditor turnover at its international subsidiaries Many reputable Big 4 auditors left Amdocs at this time and were replaced by auditors from lower tier or even no name firms

Management has historically said that it needs a minimum cash balance of 500m to smoothly fund operations which makes little sense to us We suspect that this 500m figure may represent a sum which is either trapped abroad and thus inaccessible or which simply does not exist
Amdocs also recently divested of one of its fastest growing and most profitable subs for just 1x sales half of where DOX trades Why would management rush to do this if there wasn t a need for cash
Does DOX have access to all of its cash Interest ballooned through 2019 despite DOX reporting no debt At the same time subsidiary cash balances almost universally fell to zero

This gap became noticeable in 2016 the first year in which the accounting red flags shown by began to emerge We believe that the fact that Amdocs started to show weakness just as its reported profitability began to deviate from the subs is not a coincidence

Comparing Amdocs margins with those of its subsidiaries taken together suggests that DOX s operating profitability is overstated by 40 50 or as much as 200m An analysis of the international subs suggests that Amdocs is far less profitable than the parent filings show

Upon review of dozens of Amdocs international subsidiaries which together represent the vast majority of the biz we find discrepancies suggesting wildly overstated margins misrepresented liquidity at the parent and a flood of auditor resignations within the last several years
We are revealing the results of a months long examination of what we believe are damning financial anomalies at Amdocs DOX Impossible to stay silent in light of findings Full report at
